name: stereo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ U ] a way of recording or playing sound so that it is separated into two signals and produces more natural sound: in stereo The concert will be broadcast in stereo.
[ C ] a piece of electrical equipment for playing music, listening to the radio, etc. that sounds very natural because the sounds come out of two speakers (= parts for playing sound): Loud music was coming from the car stereo.

recording or playing sound in a way that separates it into two signals and produces more natural sound, or relating to this kind of sound: a stereo system The unit's stereo speakers sounded surprisingly good. Tape was the format that introduced stereo sound into the home. Compare
mono noun (SOUND)
quadraphonic
relating to a process, camera, etc. that creates an image that looks three-dimensional (= having width, height, and depth) by presenting two slightly different images to each eye: The photographs were taken by a high-resolution stereo camera. Stereo photography is a way of capturing an image with two different shots that combine together to create a holographic effect. Compare
stereoscopic
